page.title: 08Nature of Geography.
page.content: The region is undulating,poorly drained,glacial till and river alluvium,overlying the Triassic, Keuper Marl between 16 metres and 55 metres above sea level. The natural vegetation of deciduous woodland has been restricted by farming activities isolated woods and coppices on steeper slopes,north facing areas,or particulary poorly drained land. Carey's Brook flows east into the River Severn 1km East of Callow End. The river Teme, 1 Km to the north, also flows East into the River Seven. Lowland pasture to the north and east of Powick and Callow End may be subject to seasonal flooding. It will be interesting to see the effect the new roadway, that serves the recently opened bridge over the River Severn, has on flooding.
